intro: Keraselma squamosum, commonly known as the scaly keratochilum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, scaly leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
